alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 2:42PM MST until August 17 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES ALONG WET BEAVER CREEK... At 240 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain had ended along along Wet Beaver Creek, however flooding remains a concern from earlier rainfall. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wet Beaver Creek Campground and V Bar V Visitors Center. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Brady Canyon, West Clear Creek, Rarick Canyon, Jacks Canyon, Beaver Creek, Long Canyon and Walker Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
